title: Grakn Academy
summary: This is a brief introduction to topics that will be covered in the Grakn Academy.

title: Introduction to GRAKN.AI
summary: GRAKN.AI is the database for AI. It is a hyper-relational database for knowledge-oriented systems. Grakn enables machines to manage complex data that serves as a knowledge base for cognitive/AI systems.

title: Grakn Documentation Portal
summary: Welcome to Grakn Documentation Portal, where you can find everything you need to get up to speed.

title: Contribute to GRAKN.AI
summary: This is an area for documentation specific to contributors working on the GRAKN.AI platform, documentation or examples.

title: Graql - the language of knowledge
summary: In this lesson you will learn about the dataset you will be dealing with in the Academy and will get a first taste of the Graql language

title: Why use GRAKN.AI?
summary: GRAKN.AI provides a flexible and rich data model, logical integrity, optimized and intelligent querying capabilities, and distributed analytics out-of-the-box.

title: Analytics - From Knowledge to Wisdom
summary: In this lesson you will learn about the different types of Graql Analytics query and when to use them

title: Code of Conduct
summary: This is the code of conduct for everyone working with GRAKN.AI

title: Introduction to Grakn
summary: This is a brief introduction to what a knowledge based system is, what is Grakn and the broad topics that will be covered into the Grakn Academy.

title: Loading data - Building knowledge
summary: In this lesson you will learn how to load schema and data Graql files into your Grakn distribution.

title: Logic inference - The power of knowledge
summary: In this lesson you will be introduced to logic inference and the uses of Grakn reasoning engine.

title: Schemas - The structure of knowledge
summary: In this lesson you will learn what is a Grakn schema and what are its main elements

title: What can you build with GRAKN.AI?
summary: GRAKN.AI makes building intelligent systems for complex data easy.

title: Inference rules

title: Statistics queries

title: Advanced inference rules

title: Scroll layout
summary: This page demonstrates how you the integration of a script called ScrollTo, which is used here to link definitions of a JSON code sample to a list of definitions for that particular term. The scenario here is that the JSON blocks are really long, with extensive nesting and subnesting, which makes it difficult for tables below the JSON to adequately explain the term in a usable way.
